nf_tower_options.title: NF Tower options
nf_tower_options.description: Define your tokens of NF tower

use_tower.help_text: This sets wheter you want or not to run the pipeline interactively in your nextflow tower section. Default is not to.

tower_token.help_text: If running interactively in nextflow tower you need to supply your nf-tower user token.

input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data

outdir.help_text: All the results of the pipeline will be stored under that directory.

shortreads.help_text:
Set path to your input short reads (paired or single end). For paired, users must use the following notation: "path/to/dir/pattern*_{1,2}.fastq".

It can be gzipped or not. The *_{1,2}* regex is required so that nextflow can properly load the exact read pairs. Read more [in their manual](https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/channel.html#fromfilepairs).

shortreads_type.description: Short reads are paired or single?
shortreads_type.help_text:
Which is the sequencing library used for your input reads? 'paired' or 'single'?

Note: single notation is used for unpaired data.

nanopore_fastq.help_text: Path to your nanopore reads. It can be gzipped or not.

pacbio_bamPath.help_text: Path to pacbio subreads in bam format. This applies to the majority of pacbio sequencers and chemistries.

pacbio_h5Path.help_text: Set path to the directory containing your pacbio reads in legacy (.h5) format. This applies to old/legacy pacbio sequencers and chemistries.

computational_options.title: Computational options
computational_options.description: Set the top limit for requested resources for any single job.
computational_options.help_text:
If you are running on a smaller system, a pipeline step requesting more resources than are available may cause the Nextflow to stop the run with an error. These options allow you to cap the maximum resources requested by any single job so that the pipeline will run on your system.

Note that you can not _increase_ the resources requested by any job using these options. For that you will need your own configuration file. See [the nf-core website](https://nf-co.re/usage/configuration) for details.

threads.help_text: Set the max number of threads to allocate for each process.

parallel_jobs.description: Number of jobs to run in parallel. Each job can consume up to N threads (--threads)
parallel_jobs.help_text: This must be set with caution, paying attention to the --threads parameter and the number of cores in your system, otherwise you can endup without enough memory.

long_reads_parameters.title: Long reads parameters
long_reads_parameters.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

lreads_min_length.help_text: It uses nanofilt to filter nanopore and pacbio long reads by a min. length threshold.

lreads_min_quality.help_text: It uses nanofilt to filter nanopore and pacbio long reads by a min. quality threshold.

nanopore_is_barcoded.help_text: You have barcoded nanopore reads? When using this paremeter the pipeline triggers porechop to demultiplex the data.

nanopore_sequencing_summary.help_text: Optional. Path to nanopore sequencing summary. If given, the pipeline will trigger pycoQC to calculate nanopore long reads statistics.

pacbio_barcodes.help_text: You have barcoded pacbio reads? This parameter sets path the your pacbio barcodes in fasta or xml. It will use this barcodes to demultiplex the data.

pacbio_barcode_design.help_text:
For demultiplexing you can choose how to associate the barcodes: same, different or any type of combination.

By default, only reads with 'same' barcodes in both ends are demultiplexed.

pacbio_get_hifi.help_text: This paramter will trigger pacbio ccs software to produce high fidelity reads. Not all chemistries and sequencers are compatible. If not compatible the pipeline will throw an error.

clip_r1.description: Clip n bases from 5' end of read pair 1 (or unpaired)
clip_r1.help_text: Tells trim_galore the amount of bases to trim from the 5' end of unpaired or read pair 1.

clip_r2.help_text: Tells trim_galore the amount of bases to trim from the 5' end of read pair 2.
clip_r2.description: Clip n bases from 5' end of read pair 2

three_prime_clip_r1.help_text: Tells trim_galore the amount of bases to trim from the 3' end of unpaired or read pair 1.
three_prime_clip_r1.description: Clip n bases from 3' end of read pair 1 (or unpaired)

three_prime_clip_r2.description: Clip n bases from 3' end of read pair 2
three_prime_clip_r2.help_text: Tells trim_galore the amount of bases to trim from the 3' end of read pair 2.

quality_trim.help_text: Tells to trim_galore the base quality threshold to use when trimming.

lighter_execute.help_text: Run short reads correction step with lighter.

lighter_kmer.description: Tells lighter the k-mer to use
lighter_kmer.help_text: Sets the k-mer to be used by lighter when correcting the reads

lighter_genomeSize.description: Tells lighter the expected genome size
lighter_genomeSize.help_text: Lighter requires an expected genome size in order to correct the reads

lighter_alpha.help_text:
Alpha is the sampling rate and decided by the user. A rule of thumb: alpha=(7/C), where C is the average coverage of the data set.

If blank, lighter will try to automatically calculate it

flash_execute.help_text: If used, the pipeline will use FLASH to merge paired reads.
